1.title: The Ringer

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

1.plot: Conor and Ashley recruit an NBA Player to be their ringer for a charity basketball game.

2.title: The Olym-pig Torch

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

2.plot: When Conor learns that the Olympic torch will pass through Redwood, he competes for the torchbearer title.

3.title: The Luchador

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

3.plot: Thumbs of Fury gets lost on their way to a tournament and wind up in Mexico where they instantly find themselves in trouble with the law.

4.title: The Rankening

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

4.plot: Conor and the gang find out where they rank in the International Gaming League Tournament

5.title: The Protégé

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

5.plot: After causing trouble for Janice, the gang is forced to volunteer for her Big Buddy program in which they are assigned little buddies for the week.

6.title: The Battle for Stump Hill

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

6.plot: With both Redwood and Yuba claiming they won the Battle of the Stump many years ago, the two rival towns instigate another battle to determine the winner once and for all.

7.title: The Prison Escape Movie

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

7.plot: The gamers enlist Janice's help to get into a highly anticipated action flick, but keeping her on board long enough to see the film proves far more difficult than they imagined.

8.title: The Long Weekend

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

8.plot: When the game rs get locked inside Mondale High during spring break with their least-favorite teacher, they must use their gaming skills to find a way out.

9.title: The Ghost

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

9.plot: When Ashley's late aunt leaves her a chest full of ghost-hunting equipment, Conor and Wendell see money-making potential and start their own medium business.

10.title: The Has-Been's Back

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

10.plot: Ashley is invited to a prestigious girls only tournament and the rest of the team joins her to show their support.

11.title: The DJ's

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

11.plot: Mr. Funkus gets kicked out of his mom's house, so he moves into the school and gets Franklin to join him for a DJ duo.

12.title: The Detective

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

12.plot: When Franklin's literacy fair project is destroyed, Wendell is presumed to be the culprit and is expelled; Conor sets out to prove Wendell's innocence and clear his name.

13.title: The Arcade Hero

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

13.plot: After seemingly defeating a rare arcade game at Billy's, Wendell is rewarded a special gift from the game's creator, but Conor is the one who actually won the game.

14.title: The Stings

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

14.plot: After scoring early access to an exclusive gaming map for their next tourney, Thumbs of Fury discovers their scheming gaming nemesis has returned to Mondale High.

15.title: The Rodeo

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

15.plot: Conor and Wendell join a new Rodeo fitness regime in hopes they can get ranch-ripped and win a cash prize to cover the cost of the team's upcoming trip to IGL Nationals; Ashley helps Franklin with his prom-postal idea to win over Emma.

16.title: The Big City

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

16.plot: Thumbs of Fury is ready to compete in the IGL Nationals; a major challenge.

1.title: Pilot

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

1.plot: Conor wants to get his pro card back, so he recruits new classmates Franklin, Wendell and Ashley to play the game for him. But, a failed attempt to ditch school early to practice lands them in detention with a tough teacher.

2.title: The Gaming Club

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

2.plot: The gang forms a gaming club that gets them out of gym class. Wendell goes to insane lengths to sneak into the library to return a book he borrowed in the first grade.

3.title: The Puddin Party

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

3.plot: When Wendell's life falls apart from playing too much Puddin' Party, a cheesy, kids' phone game, Conor and the rest of the crew go to extreme lengths to break him of his lame obsession.

4.title: The Chair

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

4.plot: When a sponsor sends the gang a hi-tech gamer's chair, they all want it for themselves. Franklin has a solution, a competition to see who can go the longest without gaming.

5.title: The Spirit Egg

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

5.plot: When Mondale High's beloved "Spirit Egg" is stolen by a rival school, Conor and Wendell must go undercover to get it back in time for the big pep rally.

6.title: The Rival's Arrival

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

6.plot: When Wendell introduces his new girlfriend to the gang, it turns out to be Conor's old gaming rival who wins the gang over, forcing a split between Conor and the team.

7.title: The Sponsor

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

7.plot: When the gang signs with a video game company, they're offered the perks of a high-end corporate sponsor, but only if they replace Franklin as a member of their team.

8.title: The Driving Test

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

8.plot: When Conor fails his driving test he ends up with an impossible driver's ed instructor, meanwhile Wendell and Franklin help Ashley to win Miss Frontier.

9.title: The Psycho Zombie Bloodbath

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

9.plot: Conor and the gang obtain a rare copy of one of the scariest zombie video games ever made.

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

11.title: The Prank of the Century

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

11.plot: Conor and Ashley, try to prank Franklin to win the Prank of the Century, while Wendell tries to win, by pranking Janice with a King Kong prank.

12.title: The Odd Couple

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

12.plot: After Wendell saves his life from a life-threatening accident, Conor feels indebted to his freind and allows Wendell to move in with him.

13.title: The Longest Yard

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

13.plot: Conor and Ashley give Mr. Spanks another chance at breaking the school's punting record in football while Wendell and Franklin compete to become the next school mascot.

14.title: The Penpal

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

14.plot: Conor goes undercover into the bizarre subculture of table-top, fantasy card games.

15.title: The Asteroid Blasters

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

15.plot: The gamers sneak off to use an asteroid-blasting simulator during a school field trip at a space lab.

16.title: The Chillerz

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

16.plot: Conor and the gang take a product endorsement deal to try to dethrone their arch rival Lika from being the face of the gaming world.

17.title: The Cabin

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

17.plot: During a team-building retreat in the woods, the boys find themselves trapped without food or technology.

18.title: The Super Kart

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

18.plot: Franklin's ego drives him to lose a deluxe go-kart on loan from Funtendo to some kids from Mudd Valley High. Meanwhile, Wendell learns his cousin Dwayne is engaged to his nemesis.

19.title: The Rock Band

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

19.plot: When the gang dazzles at the game "Rock Hero 5," Mr. Spanks encourages them to compete on the hit TV series "American Talent Factor."

20.title: The Goat

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

20.plot: It's a race against the clock when a goat that Conor is watching over escapes with a belly full of explosives.

21.title: The Escape Room

episode of.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything (TV Series 2015–2017)

21.plot: Conor and the team participate in the latest gaming craze, an Escape Room. When the clues lead them to a large amount of cash, they inadvertently steal the money from a gang of crooks.

imdb.plot outline: The show centers on Conor, a 15-year-old video gamer, who is forced to attend high school for the first time after a thumb injury sidelines him from the glamorous pro gaming circuit. As a coping mechanism, he begins to visualize life as a video game. He is reunited with his three former gamer friends who he left behind for life on the pro circuit World Tour, and he quickly realizes that restoring his friendships is vital in his quest to "level up" to his former glory.
imdb.title: Gamer's Guide to Pretty Much Everything
plot: Follows professional teenage video gamer, Conor, who is forced to go to high school for the first time, after a thumb injury. Coping with his new lifestyle, he focuses on friendships and visualizes life as a video game.::Anonymous

The show centers on Conor, a 15-year-old video gamer, who is forced to attend high school for the first time after a thumb injury sidelines him from the glamorous pro gaming circuit. As a coping mechanism, he begins to visualize life as a video game. He is reunited with his three former gamer friends who he left behind for life on the pro circuit World Tour, and he quickly realizes that restoring his friendships is vital in his quest to "level up" to his former glory.::Anonymous
